◆ Create()

std::unique_ptr< Object > India::TiledObjectFactory::Create ( std::string  type,
Object &  object,
std::vector< std::string >  args 
)

Instantiates the class that is bound to the provided type. The type must be registered before being called, else this function will throw a TiledObjectFactoryException.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ Register()

void India::TiledObjectFactory::Register ( std::string  type,
std::function< std::unique_ptr< Object >(Object &, std::vector< std::string >)>  constructor 
)
noexcept

Binds a string to a typeid in the factory. The first parameter is the Type property in Tiled objects. The second parameter binds to an object its constructor.
